The Invocation was delivered by Rabbi Jonathan Glass, Civic Center Synagogue, 49 White Street, New York, New York 10013.

Council Member Brewer moved  that the invocation be spread in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 010646 ZSK, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 010645 ZMK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 010647 ZSK, a special permit shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 010645 ZMK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application Number 030492 ZSK, a disposition of city-owned property shall be subject to Council review.  This application is related to application number 010645 ZMK which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By Council Member Lopez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 6012nd Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 2, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20045484 TCM.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

Items.Title:
By Council Member Moskowitz:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-226(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Transportation approving an enclosed sidewalk café located at 1022 Madison Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 4, shall be subject to review by the Council. (Application no. 20055006 TCM.)
Items.ActionText: A motion was made by  that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon the Salvation Army to cease and desist from requiring its employees or prospective employees of publicly financed institutions to reveal personal or private information about their religious affiliations or preferences, or to require such employees or prospective employees to carry out religious doctrines or faith-based initiatives in the performance of their work, in violation of Constitutional non-discrimination principles and the separation of church and state.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Salvation Army to cease and desist from requiring its employees or prospective employees of publicly financed institutions to reveal personal or private information about their religious affiliations or preferences.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting United States Senate Bill S.2471, which would regulate the transmission of personally identifiable information to foreign affiliates and subcontractors, as well as to unaffiliated third parties located in a foreign country.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Regulate the transmission of personally identifiable information to foreign affiliates and subcontractors.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the filming of motion pictures and television in the United States and the City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Supporting the filming of motion pictures and television in the United States and NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution recognizing September 18, 2004 as International Beach Cleanup Day in New York City and urging all New Yorkers to volunteer to participate in the nineteenth annual nationwide beach cleaning event.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: September 18, 2004 as International Beach Cleanup Day in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Health and Mental Hygiene (DOHMH) to declare the Bronx a rat-infested disaster area and to implement an ongoing rat extermination program based on DOHMH findings that the “rat problem in the Bronx is worse than anywhere else in the city,” and for the appropriate committee of the City Council to hold hearings on the results of the Mayor’s 2003 special rat initiative.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: DOHMH to declare the Bronx a rat-infested disaster area.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold an oversight hearing in regard to what actions are being taken by the New York City Department of Health and Mental Hygiene in order to address disparities in life expectancy between poor communities of color and wealthy communities in New York City.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Address disparities in life expectancy between poor communities of color and wealthy communities in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to grant New York City the authority to repeal the sales tax on clothing and footwear under $110.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on State and Federal Legislation due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Grant NYC the authority to repeal the sales tax on clothing and footwear under $110.

Items.Title: Resolution supporting the preservation of jobs and production activities in the United States and meaningful reforms designed to reduce incentives for companies outsourcing jobs to foreign countries.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Preservation of jobs and production activities in the United States.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notifying tenants of city-owned buildings about the potential for tenant ownership prior to disposition.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.
Items.MatterName: Notifying tenants of city-owned buildings about the potential for tenant ownership prior to disposition.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to special hydrant wrenches being issued to each police patrol car/unit so that an open hydrant can be shut off in a timely manner to prevent costly damages to City and private property, to alleviate adverse conditions of low water pressure and to ensure public safety.
Items.MatterName: Special hydrant wrenches being issued to each police patrol car/unit so that an open hydrant can be shut off in a timely manner.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the expedited review of permits or other approvals for green buildings.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/10/2004.
Items.MatterName: Expedited review of permits or other approvals for green buildings.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to creating a tenants’ bill of rights and responsibilities.
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to truth-in-pricing.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs due back on 9/15/2004.

Items.Title: Resolution denouncing Dennis Hastert, Speaker of the United States House of Representatives, for his recent criticism of New York’s efforts to secure funding for the rebuilding of New York City after the 9-11 attacks on the United States at New York’s World Trade Center and calling upon the Congress of the United States to provide continued funding and support for New York in its efforts to recover from the devastating attacks of September 11.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries & International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Denouncing Dennis Hastert, Speaker of the United States House of Representatives.

Items.Title: Resolution praising the NYPD, Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly and all other civil service employees responsible for security for their professionalism and effectiveness during the Republican National Convention and for successfully ensuring the public safety under extremely difficult circumstances.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: Praising the NYPD, Police Commissioner Raymond Kelly and all other civil service employees responsible for security for their professionalism and effectiveness during the Republican National Convention.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Department of Health and Human Services to withdraw its proposed implementation approach for Section 1011 of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement and Modernization Act of 2003, since such implementation approach would require hospitals to determine the immigration status of patients in order to be eligible for Section 1011 funds, federal money that reimburses hospitals for services provided to undocumented immigrants, and urging all hospitals in New York State to not apply for Section 1011 funds if the United States Department of Health and Human Services does not amend appropriately the proposed implementation approach.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health due back on 9/17/2004.
Items.MatterName: US Dep't of Health and Human Services to withdraw its proposed implementation approach for Section 1011 of the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement and Modernization Act of 2003.

Items.Title: State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill introduced by Senator Marchi, S.7737, “AN ACT to authorize Jean Sergent to purchase service credit in the New York city teachers’ retirement system”.
Items.MatterName: Authorize Jean Sergent to purchase service credit in the New York city teachers' retirement system (S.7737)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to reporting by the police department.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety due back on 9/15/2004.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to allow municipal legislative bodies to adopt more stringent legislation in relation to training, background checks and licensing/registration for private security personnel to address the deficiency of current security measures.
Items.MatterName: Adopt more stringent legislation in relation to training, background checks and licensing/registration for private security personnel.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the appeals of rejections of an application for a certificate of occupancy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.
Items.MatterName: The appeals of rejections of an application for a certificate of occupancy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to education of homeowners.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York City charter, in relation to the promulgation of Department of Buildings Legal, Administrative, Operational and Technical Policy and Procedure Notices.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.
Items.MatterName: Promulgation of Department of Buildings Legal, Administrative, Operational and Technical Policy and Procedure Notices.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to banning the sale of novelty lighters and prohibiting the sale of all lighters to persons under eighteen years of age.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs due back on 9/15/2004.
Items.MatterName: Banning the sale of novelty lighters and prohibiting the sale of all lighters to persons under eighteen years of age.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to appeals for approval of applications and plans.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.
Items.MatterName: Appeals for approval of applications and plans.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.
Items.MatterName: Revenues and expenditures of the department of buildings for plan examinations and applications for certificates of occupancy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to certificates of occupancy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.
Items.MatterName: In relation to certificates of occupancy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to filing for certificates of occupancy.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings due back on 9/15/2004.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Fordham Road business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance due back on 9/15/2004.

Items.Title: Resolution concerning the establishment of the Fordham Road Business Improvement District in the Borough of the Bronx and setting the date, time and place for the public hearing to hear all persons interested in the establishment of such district.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance due back on 9/17/2004.

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health due back on 9/15/2004.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing a film production credit.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance due back on 9/15/2004.

Items.Title: Uniform Land Use Review Procedure application no. 010645 ZMK, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the New York City Charter, concerning changes to the zoning map, Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 33.

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 010646 ZSK, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 33 to allow mixed - use building without regard to yard, court, and height and set-back regulations.  This application is subject to review and action by the Land Use Committee only if appealed to the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(2) of the Charter or called-up by vote of the Council pursuant to §197-d(b)(3) of the Charter.

Uniform land use review procedure application no. 010647 ZMK, pursuant to §197-c and §197-d of the Charter of the City of New York concerning a special permit under the Zoning Resolution in the Borough of Brooklyn, Council District no. 33 to allow an attended public parking garage with a maximum capacity of 327 spaces and to allow floor space up to a height of 23 feet above curb level to be exempt from the definition of floor area.
